pageTitle: Itinerary for Friday, July 8, 2016 | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Itinerary for the Prime Minister, Justin Trudeau, for Friday, July 8 2016:

Warsaw, Republic of Poland

5:15 a.m. The Prime Minister will arrive in Warsaw, Republic of Poland.

Warsaw Chopin Airport

Note for media:

  • Photo opportunity only


1:35 p.m. The Prime Minister will arrive at the NATO Summit Warsaw 2016.

PGE National Stadium

Notes for media:

  • Coverage by host broadcaster
  • Pooled photo opportunity


2:45 p.m. The Prime Minister will be greeted by the President of the Republic of Poland, His Excellency Andrzej Duda, and Secretary General of NATO, Mr. Jens Stoltenberg.

PGE National Stadium

Note for media:

  • Pooled photo opportunity


3:15 p.m. The Prime Minister will take part in the NATO Family Photograph.

PGE National Stadium

Notes for media:

  • Coverage by host broadcaster
  • Pooled photo opportunity


3:30 p.m. The Prime Minister will participate in the Opening Session of the North Atlantic Council Meeting.

PGE National Stadium

Notes for media:

  • Coverage by host broadcaster
  • Pooled coverage of opening remarks


6:30 p.m. The Prime Minister will hold a bilateral meeting with the President of the Republic of Afghanistan, His Excellency Ashraf Ghani.

PGE National Stadium

Note for media:

  • Pooled photo opportunity


7:20 p.m. The Prime Minister will observe the fly-past.

PGE National Stadium

Note for media:

  • Pooled photo opportunity


8:00 p.m. The Prime Minister will participate in the North Atlantic Council Working Dinner.

Presidential Palace

Notes for media:

  • Pooled photo opportunity of the arrival
  • Restricted visual media pool at the beginning of the dinner


Please note: all times are local.

PMO Media Relations:
media@pmo-cpm.gc.ca
613-957-5555
